fields.label: translate:: Display "Back" button
fields.description: translate:: Display button for navigating back to your previous scene

fields.label: translate:: Unique scene id
fields.description: translate:: Must be unique, used for navigation between scenes

fields.label: translate:: Scene Title
fields.description: translate:: Used to identify the scene for authors

fields.label: translate:: Scene Description
fields.description: translate:: A text that can describe the scene for the end-user

fields.label: translate:: Initial camera position
fields.description: translate:: Camera position in pitch and yaw

fields.label: translate:: Interaction position
fields.description: translate:: Interaction position in pitch and yaw

fields.label: translate:: Button style
fields.description: translate:: Decide how buttons pointing to this scene should look. For scenes that are static and does not lead to new scenes, we recommend the "More information" button.

fields.label: translate:: Audio Track
fields.description: translate:: Add an audio track that's specific for this scene.

semantics.label: translate:: Behavioural settings
semantics.description: translate:: These options will let you control how the world behaves.

fields.label: translate:: Global Audio
fields.description: translate:: Add an audio track that's available for all of the scenes by default.

fields.label: translate:: Scene rendering quality
fields.description: translate:: Choose the amount of width and height segments used to render a scene. This directly affects the quality level of the scene, try increasing the quality if a scene looks "blocky" or "waves" are seen within the scenes. Note that higher quality rendering takes more time to load.
